text: Karabad (, also Romanized as Karābād and Karrābād; also known as Garābād and Karrāwa) is a village in Razab Rural District, in the Central District of Sarvabad County, Kurdistan Province, Iran. At the 2006 census, its population was 665, in 164 families. It has long been a center for cattle herders. More recently oil has been discovered in the area, and many businesses have been attracted. This has had a beneficial effect on the local economy. == References == ==External links== *Karabad at the GeoNet Names Server *Karabad at MapLandia.com *Karabad Map at FallingRain.com *Geography population map at Tageo.com, retrieved September 5, 2007.
